Recorded in HollandÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s adopted home of Cali, Columbia, Look Around the Corner offers funky soul with a south-of-the-border twist, courtesy of QuanticÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s current band project Combo BÃƒÂ¡rbaro. Mixing warm, brassy funk and soul grooves with Latin jazz and cumbia, itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s a soft sort of fusion, mixing flavours with a lightness of touch.

The title-track blends florid soul and cosmic lyrics to a swinging, funky backbeat, like Minnie RipertonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Les Fleurs with a spot of swagger in its step. Travelling Song sets RussellÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s spectacular soul voice to a Latin strut decorated with group backing vocals and warmly produced strings. But thereÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s trouble in paradise, too. Su Suzy ups the tempo, a barrio soul lament about a woman trapped in a violent relationship, powered by Afro-Cuban rhythms, horns that sound like a warning, and a sonic effect that mimics the sound of approaching police sirens.

It is, as youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢d expect, expertly played Ã¢â‚¬â€œ but thereÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s a vividness to Look Around the Corner that reaches some way beyond mere chops. ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s an exceptional collaboration that proves thereÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s life in the old soul yet.
